transcripts.text: Here is your latest Africa news update.  American-born Senegalese singer Akon, in a recent interview with media personality Nick Cannon, revealed that he has started work on developing his own city in Senegal called Akon City.  According to him, he started building the city since March this year and he is expected that it will be completed in 10 years' time.
You building your own city.  Tell me about that, man.  Is it called Acon Land?  Aconville?
The city is going to be called Acon.  And it's like a new, like it's a future city.  Everything's ran on futuristic stuff, right?
It's all renewable.  The Acon solar attainment city is all renewable.
And this ain't like no Sims game or nothing.  This is a real physical place that people can go to.
Yeah, a real physical place.  It's going to have a real airport.
My man got his own city.  It's some real coming to America.  He's got his own money.  You got an acorn and you have your own city.  And when will Acon City be complete?
Well, it's a 10-year building block, so we're doing it in stages.  We started construction in March, and stage two is going to be 2025.
And where is the city located?
This is Senegal, West Africa.  Right.

He also revealed that he will use his cryptocurrency, Acoin, to build the city's economy and the whole city will have its own airport for people to fly in and out.  He announced the news last June that he was working on building a 100% crypto-based city.  According to a statement about Akon, the city will be built on 2,000 acres of land gifted to Akon from the president of Senegal and will be a five-minute drive to the airport, plus nearby to Senegal's capital, Dakar.  And please feel free to leave your suggestions, news tips or topics about Africa you'd like us to cover.
